page.title: 09Foxhole Mine
page.content: As with most of the mines the tin ore dug from the hillside was transported to the crusher by small trucks. In the case of this mine along a granite tramway. Using water power the ore was crushed, the waterwheel being in a pit, and driven by water from a leat. The tailrace of the wheel was used to drive the {Buddles. } This consisted of a pivot with two arms projecting horizonally. Tied to the arms were pieces a sacking or heather. The water from the tailrace turned the arms. Crushed rock from the main wheel was carried in water to the buddles. The gravel was washed out amd the heavier tin ore sunk to the bottem of the buddle pit, and was eventually extracted.
